1.verse: Greeting - Paul, a prisoner of Christ Jesus, and Timothy our brother: To Philemon our dear friend and coworker,

2.verse: to Apphia our sister, to Archippus our fellow soldier, and to the church that meets in your home.

3.verse: Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.

4.verse: Philemon’s Love and Faith - I always thank my God when I mention you in my prayers,

5.verse: because I hear of your love for all the saints and the faith that you have in the Lord Jesus.

6.verse: I pray that your participation in the faith may become effective through knowing every good thing that is in us for the glory of Christ.

7.verse: For I have great joy and encouragement from your love, because the hearts of the saints have been refreshed through you, brother.

8.verse: An Appeal for Onesimus - For this reason, although I have great boldness in Christ to command you to do what is right,

9.verse: I appeal to you, instead, on the basis of love. I, Paul, as an elderly man and now also as a prisoner of Christ Jesus,

10.verse: appeal to you for my son, Onesimus. I became his father while I was in chains.

11.verse: Once he was useless to you, but now he is useful both to you and to me.

12.verse: I am sending him back to you—I am sending my very own heart.

13.verse: I wanted to keep him with me, so that in my imprisonment for the gospel he might serve me in your place.

14.verse: But I didn’t want to do anything without your consent, so that your good deed might not be out of obligation, but of your own free will.

15.verse: For perhaps this is why he was separated from you for a brief time, so that you might get him back permanently,

16.verse: no longer as a slave, but more than a slave—as a dearly loved brother. He is especially so to me, but how much more to you, both in the flesh and in the Lord.

17.verse: So if you consider me a partner, welcome him as you would me.

18.verse: And if he has wronged you in any way, or owes you anything, charge that to my account.

19.verse: I, Paul, write this with my own hand: I will repay it—not to mention to you that you owe me even your very self.

20.verse: Yes, brother, may I benefit from you in the Lord; refresh my heart in Christ.

21.verse: Since I am confident of your obedience, I am writing to you, knowing that you will do even more than I say.

22.verse: Meanwhile, also prepare a guest room for me, since I hope that through your prayers I will be restored to you.

23.verse: Final Greetings - Epaphras, my fellow prisoner in Christ Jesus, sends you greetings, and so do

24.verse: Mark, Aristarchus, Demas, and Luke, my coworkers.

25.verse: The grace of the Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit.
